{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.15767v1", "title": "Is there a Birch Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture for Dedekind zeta functions?", "summary": "A Birch Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture for number fields $K / \mathbb{Q}$ would
assert that $dim V_K = ord_{s = 1/2} \zeta_K (s)$ for some vector space
functorially attached to $K$. Presently there is no natural candidate for the
$V_K$'s. However, assuming $V_K$ is of a cohomological nature and assuming a
conjecture of Serre on the vanishing order of $\zeta_K (s)$ at $s = 1/2$ we
show that such functors $K \mapsto V_K$ (with natural extra structures) exist
and are all isomorphic. Their common automorphism group is $2$-torsion and
abelian.", "main_category": "math.NT", "categories": "math.NT", "published": "2025-04-22T10:25:17Z"}
